  • Description: RESPONDED TO HAZARDOUS MATERIAL SITUATION. THERE WAS NO SPILLAGE. NO 5 PART FORMS.NO UN INFORMATION. NO DIAMOND LABELS WERE INCLUDED IN THIS SHIPMENT. THE CONTENTS WAS NITROUS OXIDE CYLINDERS. THE INNER CARTONS WERE STORE SHELF BOXES MARKED WITH A NON FLAMMABLE GAS DIAMOND LABEL AND SECONDARY LABEL WAS AN OXIDIZER 5.1 DIAMOND LABEL. NO HAZARDOUS MARKING ON THE OUTER CARTON. (25 PACKAGES) WITH NO INDICATION ON THE OUTER BOX IT CONTAINS ANY HAZARDOUS MATERIAL.

item.title: Report E-2024070038
item.description:
Report E-2024070038

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: BURTON
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was exiting highway to stop at the facility and heard a whoosh sound thought he had blown a tire he stopped and checked and tires were good. He then proceeded to facility and when doing a post trip he noticed the top of the trailer had residue on it that had come from the pressure relief valve. He then called the emergency number at 0800ET. Crews were dispatched and arrive at approximately 1300ET to clean the residue off the tanker. The crew dawned the proper PPE and proceeded to clean the residue and dispose of the cleaning rags in the appropriate manor. The crew was complete at 1700ET.

item.title: Report E-2024070054
item.description:
Report E-2024070054

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: GARDEN CITY
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 1-gallon of UN1866 Class 3 PGII " SUPER DIAMOND CLEAR" was released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to being punctured by a forklift impacting the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and dispatched Clean Harbors to assist with cleanup. Clean Harbors advised one pail was damaged and the spilled material was impacting 4 other pails. Clean Harbors cleaned the released material and containerized the waste into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum and one (1) 55-gallon metal drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024070068
item.description:
Report X-2024070068

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-20
  • City: MADISON HEIGHTS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN MADISON HEIGHTS, MICHIGAN, ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE MARZ WHIP NITROUS OXIDE CHARGER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM MICHIGAN USING UPS ACCOUNT 2451R8, AMAZON MFN, 333 108TH AVE NE, BELLEVUE WA 98004-5703.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN MADISON HEIGHTS, MICHIGAN, PACKAGES FROM A NEW ACCOUNT WERE INSPECTED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED MARZ MAX PLUS NITROUS OXIDE FOAMING WHIPPED CREAM CHARGERS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON EITHER OUTER BOX. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO ANOTHER CONSIGNEE IN THE USA IS 1ZJ14H000129003322. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM MICHIGAN USING UPS ACCOUNT J14H00, AMAZONMARKETPLACE, 43763 VAN DYKE AVE, STERLING HEIGHTS MI 48314. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024060692
item.description:
Report E-2024060692

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-16
  • City: BYRON CENTER
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately 15 gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris and the damaged drum into one (1) 65-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
